alert.note: Alert for Clay (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 04 at 5:19PM CDT until October 04 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CLAY...NORTHEASTERN ARCHER AND SOUTHEASTERN WICHITA COUNTIES... At 519 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles west of Jolly, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported a 58 mph wind gust in southwest Wichita Falls. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Iowa Park, Scotland, Dean, Jolly, Lake Arrowhead, Sheppard AFB, Lakeside City, Pleasant Valley, and Cashion. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
